titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 249) to restore the prohibition on the commercial sale and slaughter of wild free-roaming horses and burros.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-109, by Ms. Sutton.
All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 44.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 331.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 4/26/2007--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 249 (commercial sale and slaughter of wild free-roaming horses and burros prohibition).
